channel.title: Proposition For Another New Feature
channel.description:
Well since we're posting all these great suggestions that aren't ever going to be addressed, I figure I might as well add another to the list: thread-level moderation.
There should be privileges for people (or better yet, certain people, like CMs) who create threads that allow them to delete posts of others that are intentionally spam. Deletion would result in a small message left in its place stating that it was deleted by the OP, and a reason for deletion (which would be mandatory) would be listed. Obviously moderators would still be able to see the deleted posts, which would make the thread authors liable for their actions. Another feature could be added to prevent deleting really old posts; if the post is older than 2 weeks, for example, then it cannot be deleted by a thread author, because it is assumed he has had more than enough time to review it and determine its relevancy. This, obviously, would serve to prevent abuse on buried threads.
Ultimately the idea is to help move the burden of monitoring dumbass posts that people constantly make from moderators (who really don't give a shit) to thread authors (who actually do).
Go ahead and discuss, but [b]please don't troll[/b]. It's not like there's a feature that lets me force you assholes stay on topic.

item.title: Proposition For Another New Feature
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Elijah:

What I read from Mopmans post, was not fear of abuse. Or lack of trust. But more along the lines of how few people there are that would be in the usergroup in the first place. The amount of regular topic posters is minimal. And the amount of actual worthwhile topics is even smaller. We might see maybe 9 or 10 people tops get this ability. And considering how few that number is, they would be better suited as sectional moderators.

even if we ignore the fact that that number is probably grossly underestimated, so what? if 10 people benefit then it will be worth it, because it doesn’t take much work to install (it already exists) and it actually helps relieve the burden of moderating from the moderators. that was one of the main points, try to follow along.

besides, hiding posts is much better than the shitty warning system that is already in place, both short and long term. if your posts get constantly hidden from everyone else because you’re always acting like a fucktard, then you’re probably going to either A) stop being a fucktard, or B) stop wasting your time posting like one.
